input: Our results suggest, but do not confirm, that a possible advantage of ultrasound guidance for the first attempt success rate over other techniques is more pronounced in infants and small children than in older children.
output: Our research shows that ultrasound guidance may help with the success rate of the first attempt more in babies and younger children than in older children, but more research is needed to be sure.
gold: La evidencia indica que la ecografía es superior a otras técnicas para la inserción de catéteres arteriales, en particular en los recién nacidos y los niños pequeños.
translated_output: Nuestra investigación muestra que la guía por ultrasonido puede ayudar con la tasa de éxito del primer intento más en bebés y niños pequeños que en niños mayores, pero se necesita más investigación para estar seguros.
old_gold: Our evidence suggests that ultrasound is superior to other techniques for arterial catheter insertion, particularly in babies and young children.

input: We included seven trials, involving 735 participants, in this review.
output: This review looked at seven different experiments that included a total of 735 people taking part.
gold: Esta revisión incluyó siete estudios (específicamente ensayos controlados aleatorizados), en los que participaron 735 pacientes.
translated_output: Esta revisión analizó siete experimentos diferentes que incluyeron un total de 735 personas que participaron.
old_gold: This review included seven studies (specifically randomised controlled trials), involving 735 people.

input: We searched until January 2016.
output: We looked for something until the end of January 2016.
gold: La evidencia está actualizada hasta enero 2016.
translated_output: Buscamos algo hasta finales de enero de 2016.
old_gold: The evidence is current to January 2016.

input: Remote ischaemic conditioning (RIC) has been developed as a neuroprotective strategy to prevent and treat ischaemic stroke.
output: Remote Ischemic Conditioning is a way to help protect your brain from stroke. It helps to prevent stroke and can also help treat it if you already have one.
gold: El condicionamiento isquémico remoto (CIR) es una estrategia para proteger y prevenir el daño al tejido cerebral al mejorar su capacidad de tolerar la reducción del flujo sanguíneo.
translated_output: El condicionamiento isquémico remoto es una forma de ayudar a proteger su cerebro de un accidente cerebrovascular. Ayuda a prevenir un accidente cerebrovascular y también puede ayudar a tratarlo si ya tiene uno.
old_gold: Remote ischaemic conditioning (RIC) is a strategy to protect and prevent damage to brain tissue by improving its ability to tolerate reduced blood flow.

input: To assess the benefits and harms of RIC for preventing ischaemic stroke and for treating people with ischaemic stroke and those at risk for ischaemic stroke.
output: This sentence is asking us to find out if a certain type of medical treatment (RIC) is helpful in preventing and treating strokes. We want to know if the benefits of using RIC are greater than the risks.
gold: ¿Cuáles son los efectos beneficiosos del uso del condicionamiento isquémico remoto (una fisioterapia no invasiva que incluye inflar manguitos de presión arterial para reducir el flujo sanguíneo en los brazos y las piernas y luego liberar la sangre afectada hacia todo el cuerpo) en los pacientes con accidente cerebrovascular o en los que tienen riesgo de accidente cerebrovascular causado por la reducción del flujo sanguíneo?
translated_output: Esta oración nos pide que averigüemos si cierto tipo de tratamiento médico (RIC, por sus siglas en inglés) es útil para prevenir y tratar los accidentes cerebrovasculares. Queremos saber si los beneficios de usar RIC son mayores que los riesgos.
old_gold: What are the benefits of using remote ischaemic conditioning (a noninvasive physical therapy that involves inflating blood pressure cuffs to reduce blood flow in arms and legs, and then releasing the affected blood around the body) in people with stroke or those at risk of stroke caused by low blood flow?

input: We included randomised controlled trials (RCTs) comparing RIC with sham RIC or medical management in people with ischaemic stroke or at risk of ischaemic stroke.
output: We looked at studies that compared a certain medical treatment called RIC with either a fake treatment or other medical treatments with people who had a stroke or were at risk of having a stroke.
gold: Los estudios compararon CIR con CIR simulado o tratamiento médico en pacientes con accidente cerebrovascular isquémico o con riesgo de accidente cerebrovascular isquémico.
translated_output: Examinamos estudios que compararon un determinado tratamiento médico llamado RIC con un tratamiento falso u otros tratamientos médicos en personas que sufrieron un accidente cerebrovascular o estaban en riesgo de sufrir un accidente cerebrovascular.
old_gold: The studies compared RIC with sham RIC or medical management in people with ischaemic stroke or at risk of ischaemic stroke.

input: In people with symptomatic intracerebral artery stenosis, recurrent stroke was significantly reduced by RIC (risk ratio (RR) 0.32, 95% confidence interval (CI) 0.12 to 0.83; 2 trials, 182 participants, low-quality evidence).
output: In people who have a blockage in an artery in the brain and are having symptoms from it, taking a certain medicine called RIC was found to help reduce the chances of having another stroke. This was tested in two studies with 182 people, and the results showed that taking RIC decreased the risk of stroke by 32%.
gold: En los pacientes con estrechamiento de las arterias del cerebro, el CIR puede reducir el riesgo de accidente cerebrovascular recurrente.
translated_output: En las personas que tienen una obstrucción en una arteria del cerebro y presentan síntomas, se descubrió que tomar cierto medicamento llamado RIC ayuda a reducir las posibilidades de sufrir otro accidente cerebrovascular. Esto se probó en dos estudios con 182 personas, y los resultados mostraron que tomar RIC redujo el riesgo de accidente cerebrovascular en un 32 %.
old_gold: In people with narrowing of arteries in the brain, RIC may reduce the risk of recurrent stroke.

input: Four RCTs compared ultrasound with palpation, and one compared ultrasound with Doppler auditory assistance.
output: Four studies looked at the differences between using ultrasound and feeling with your hands, and one study looked at the differences between using ultrasound and listening with special equipment.
gold: Se encontraron cinco estudios aptos: cuatro que compararon la ecografía con palpación y uno que comparó la ecografía con asistencia auditiva con Doppler.
translated_output: Cuatro estudios analizaron las diferencias entre usar ultrasonido y sentir con las manos, y un estudio analizó las diferencias entre usar ultrasonido y escuchar con un equipo especial.
old_gold: We found five eligible studies - four comparing ultrasound with palpation and one comparing ultrasound with Doppler auditory assistance.

input: Preclinical studies have suggested that RIC may have beneficial effects in ischaemic stroke patients and those at risk of ischaemic stroke.
output: Medical research has shown that a certain type of treatment called RIC may help people who have had a stroke or are at risk of having a stroke.
gold: Los estudios han indicado que el CIR puede tener efectos beneficiosos en la prevención y el tratamiento del accidente cerebrovascular isquémico.
translated_output: La investigación médica ha demostrado que cierto tipo de tratamiento llamado RIC puede ayudar a las personas que han tenido un derrame cerebral o que corren el riesgo de sufrir un derrame cerebral.
old_gold: Studies have suggested that RIC may have beneficial effects for preventing and treating ischaemic stroke.

input: The improved success rate at the first attempt may be more pronounced in infants and small children, in whom arterial line cannulation is more challenging than in older children.
output: This sentence means that when doctors try to put a tube into a baby or small child's artery, it is harder than it is for an older child. But, when doctors do succeed the first time, it is a more noticeable success than when they are working with an older child.
gold: Es probable que la ecografía sea más útil para los neonatos y los niños pequeños que para los niños mayores.
translated_output: Esta oración significa que cuando los médicos intentan colocar un tubo en la arteria de un bebé o un niño pequeño, es más difícil que para un niño mayor. Pero, cuando los médicos tienen éxito la primera vez, es un éxito más notable que cuando están trabajando con un niño mayor.
old_gold: It is likely that ultrasound is more useful for infants and small children than for older children.

input: We searched the Cochrane Stroke Group Trials Register (16 January 2018), the Cochrane Central Register of Controlled Trials (CENTRAL; 2017, Issue 12) in the Cochrane Library (January 2018), MEDLINE Ovid (1946 to January 2018), Embase Ovid (1974 to January 2018), Web of Science Core Collection (1950 to January 2018) and three Chinese databases (January 2018).
output: We looked for information about stroke from six different places: the Cochrane Stroke Group Trials Register, the Cochrane Central Register of Controlled Trials, the Cochrane Library, MEDLINE Ovid, Embase Ovid, Web of Science Core Collection, and three Chinese databases. We looked for information from 1946 to January 2018.
gold: Los resultados de esta revisión están vigentes hasta enero de 2018.
translated_output: Buscamos información sobre el accidente cerebrovascular en seis lugares diferentes: el Registro de ensayos del Grupo Cochrane de Accidentes Cerebrovasculares, el Registro Central Cochrane de Ensayos Controlados, la Biblioteca Cochrane, MEDLINE Ovid, Embase Ovid, Web of Science Core Collection y tres bases de datos chinas. Buscamos información desde 1946 hasta enero de 2018.
old_gold: The results of this review are current up to January 2018.

input: We included five RCTs reporting 444 arterial cannulations in paediatric participants.
output: We studied five groups of children and counted how many times doctors put a tube into their blood vessels (called "arterial cannulations"). In total, 444 kids had a tube put in their blood vessel.
gold: Se encontraron cinco estudios aptos: cuatro que compararon la ecografía con palpación y uno que comparó la ecografía con asistencia auditiva con Doppler.
translated_output: Estudiamos cinco grupos de niños y contamos cuántas veces los médicos colocaron un tubo en sus vasos sanguíneos (llamados "canulaciones arteriales"). En total, a 444 niños se les colocó un tubo en el vaso sanguíneo.
old_gold: We found five eligible studies - four comparing ultrasound with palpation and one comparing ultrasound with Doppler auditory assistance.

input: The improved success rate at the first attempt may be more pronounced in infants and small children, in whom arterial line cannulation is more challenging than in older children.
output: The chance of being successful the first time is higher in babies and younger children than in older children when doctors try to put a tube into their artery. This is because it is harder to do in babies and younger children.
gold: Se encontró que la ecografía aumentó la tasa de canulación exitosa al primer intento y redujo la formación de hematomas.
translated_output: La probabilidad de tener éxito la primera vez es mayor en bebés y niños más pequeños que en niños mayores cuando los médicos intentan colocar un tubo en la arteria. Esto se debe a que es más difícil hacerlo en bebés y niños pequeños.
old_gold: We found that ultrasound increased the rate of successful cannulation at the first attempt and reduced the formation of haematomas.

input: Meta-analysis showed that ultrasound guidance produces superior success rates at first attempt (risk ratio (RR) 1.96, 95% confidence interval (CI) 1.34 to 2.85, 404 catheters, four RCTs, moderate-quality evidence) and fewer complications, such as haematoma formation (RR 0.20, 95% CI 0.07 to 0.60, 222 catheters, two RCTs, moderate-quality evidence).
output: The study found that when doctors use ultrasound to help guide them, they are more likely to get it right the first time (almost two times more likely) and cause less harm (five times less likely) than without ultrasound.
gold: Se encontró que la ecografía aumentó la tasa de canulación exitosa al primer intento y redujo la formación de hematomas.
translated_output: El estudio encontró que cuando los médicos usan el ultrasonido como guía, es más probable que lo hagan bien la primera vez (casi dos veces más probable) y causen menos daño (cinco veces menos probable) que sin ultrasonido.
old_gold: We found that ultrasound increased the rate of successful cannulation at the first attempt and reduced the formation of haematomas.

input: We included three trials (involving 371 participants) in the analysis of the effects of RIC on ischaemic stroke prevention.
output: We looked at the effects of RIC on preventing strokes by running experiments with 371 people. We used the results of these experiments to help us understand the effects of RIC.
gold: Tres ensayos (que incluyeron 371 pacientes) fueron elegibles para el análisis del CIR para la prevención del accidente cerebrovascular isquémico, y otros cuatro ensayos (que incluyeron 364 pacientes) fueron elegibles para el análisis del CIR para el tratamiento del accidente cerebrovascular isquémico.
translated_output: Observamos los efectos de RIC en la prevención de accidentes cerebrovasculares realizando experimentos con 371 personas. Usamos los resultados de estos experimentos para ayudarnos a comprender los efectos de RIC.
old_gold: Three trials (involving 371 people) were eligible for our analysis of RIC for preventing ischaemic stroke, and another four trials (involving 364 people) were eligible for our analysis of RIC for treating ischaemic stroke.

input: In people with carotid stenosis undergoing carotid stenting, there was no significant difference in the incidence of ischaemic stroke between participants treated with RIC and non-RIC (RR 0.22, 95% CI 0.01 to 4.03; 1 trial, 189 participants, low-quality evidence); however the stroke severity (assessed by infarct volume) was significantly lower in participants treated with RIC (mean difference (MD) -0.17 mL, 95% CI -0.23 to -0.11; 1 trial, 189 participants, low-quality evidence).
output: People with carotid stenosis (a narrowed artery in the neck) had a medical procedure called carotid stenting. In this procedure, some people received a special treatment called RIC (Remote Ischemic Conditioning). The study showed that there was no big difference in the number of people who had a stroke after the procedure between those who received RIC and those who did not. However, the study did show that people who received RIC had less severe strokes than those who did not receive RIC.
gold: En los pacientes que reciben tratamiento de colocación de un stent (inserción de un tubo metálico o plástico) por el estrechamiento de las arterias del cuello, el CIR puede reducir el tamaño de las nuevas lesiones cerebrales causadas por la reducción del flujo sanguíneo.
translated_output: Las personas con estenosis carotídea (una arteria estrechada en el cuello) se sometieron a un procedimiento médico llamado colocación de stent carotídeo. En este procedimiento, algunas personas recibieron un tratamiento especial llamado RIC (Remote Ischemic Conditioning). El estudio mostró que no hubo una gran diferencia en la cantidad de personas que sufrieron un accidente cerebrovascular después del procedimiento entre las que recibieron RIC y las que no. Sin embargo, el estudio mostró que las personas que recibieron RIC tuvieron accidentes cerebrovasculares menos graves que las que no recibieron RIC.
old_gold: In people being treated with stenting (the insertion of a metal or plastic tube) for narrowed arteries in the neck, RIC may reduce the size of new brain injuries caused by reduced blood flow.

input: We rated the quality of evidence for all outcomes as moderate owing to imprecision due to wide confidence intervals, modest sample sizes and limited numbers of events.
output: We looked at all the results and decided that the evidence was only okay. This was because the results were not very exact, and there weren't a lot of people studied, and not many things happened.
gold: Se ha evaluado la calidad de la evidencia como moderada, principalmente debido a que el número de estudios fue limitado.
translated_output: Observamos todos los resultados y decidimos que la evidencia estaba bien. Esto se debió a que los resultados no fueron muy exactos, no se estudió a mucha gente y no sucedieron muchas cosas.
old_gold: We rated the quality of evidence as moderate mainly because the number of studies was limited.

input: It usually involves restricting blood flow to limbs and then releasing the ischaemic blood to promote a neuroprotective effect.
output: This sentence is talking about a medical procedure called Ischaemic Preconditioning (IPC). The procedure involves temporarily cutting off the flow of blood to certain parts of the body and then releasing the blood back into the body. The goal of this procedure is to protect the brain and nervous system from damage.
gold: El condicionamiento isquémico remoto (CIR) es una estrategia para proteger y prevenir el daño al tejido cerebral al mejorar su capacidad de tolerar la reducción del flujo sanguíneo.
translated_output: Esta oración está hablando de un procedimiento médico llamado Preacondicionamiento Isquémico (IPC). El procedimiento consiste en cortar temporalmente el flujo de sangre a ciertas partes del cuerpo y luego devolver la sangre al cuerpo. El objetivo de este procedimiento es proteger el cerebro y el sistema nervioso del daño.
old_gold: Remote ischaemic conditioning (RIC) is a strategy to protect and prevent damage to brain tissue by improving its ability to tolerate reduced blood flow.

input: In acute ischaemic stroke, for people receiving intravenous thrombolysis, the rate of death or dependency was significantly increased by RIC treatment compared with non-RIC treatment (RR 2.34; 95% 1.19 to 4.61; 1 trial, 285 participants, low-quality evidence).
output: In people who had a stroke and were given medicine through a vein to try and stop the stroke from getting worse, those who also received a certain type of treatment (called RIC) were more likely to die or be dependent on someone else for help than those who didn't receive the RIC treatment.
gold: Entre los pacientes con accidente cerebrovascular isquémico agudo (en los que solo habían pasado varias horas desde el inicio de los síntomas) que recibieron fármacos para disolver los coágulos, se encontró que el CIR puede aumentar el riesgo de muerte o dependencia (necesitar la ayuda de otros).
translated_output: En las personas que sufrieron un accidente cerebrovascular y se les administró un medicamento por vía intravenosa para tratar de evitar que el accidente cerebrovascular empeorara, los que también recibieron cierto tipo de tratamiento (llamado RIC) tenían más probabilidades de morir o depender de otra persona para recibir ayuda que los que no recibieron el tratamiento RIC.
old_gold: Among people with acute ischaemic stroke (where it had only been several hours from symptom onset) who received clot-dissolving medicines, we found that RIC may increase the risk of death or dependency (needing help from others).

input: In people with carotid stenosis undergoing carotid stenting, there was no significant difference in the incidence of ischaemic stroke between participants treated with RIC and non-RIC (RR 0.22, 95% CI 0.01 to 4.03; 1 trial, 189 participants, low-quality evidence); however the stroke severity (assessed by infarct volume) was significantly lower in participants treated with RIC (mean difference (MD) -0.17 mL, 95% CI -0.23 to -0.11; 1 trial, 189 participants, low-quality evidence).
output: People with a condition called carotid stenosis were studied to see if it is better to treat them with a procedure called carotid stenting or not. The results showed that there was not much difference in the number of people who had strokes after the procedure, but the people who had carotid stenting had strokes that were not as bad as the people who did not have the procedure.
gold: Sin embargo, su efecto sobre los resultados clínicos (accidente cerebrovascular y muerte) no estuvo claro.
translated_output: Se estudió a personas con una afección llamada estenosis carotídea para ver si era mejor tratarlas con un procedimiento llamado colocación de stent carotídeo o no. Los resultados mostraron que no hubo mucha diferencia en la cantidad de personas que sufrieron accidentes cerebrovasculares después del procedimiento, pero las personas a las que se les colocó un stent en la carótida tuvieron accidentes cerebrovasculares que no fueron tan graves como las personas que no se sometieron al procedimiento.
old_gold: However, its effect on clinical outcomes (stroke and death) was unclear.

input: We included four trials (involving 364 participants) in the analysis of the effects of RIC on ischaemic stroke treatment.
output: We looked at four different tests with 364 people to see if RIC (whatever that is) can help treat strokes.
gold: Tres ensayos (que incluyeron 371 pacientes) fueron elegibles para el análisis del CIR para la prevención del accidente cerebrovascular isquémico, y otros cuatro ensayos (que incluyeron 364 pacientes) fueron elegibles para el análisis del CIR para el tratamiento del accidente cerebrovascular isquémico.
translated_output: Analizamos cuatro pruebas diferentes con 364 personas para ver si RIC (sea lo que sea) puede ayudar a tratar los accidentes cerebrovasculares.
old_gold: Three trials (involving 371 people) were eligible for our analysis of RIC for preventing ischaemic stroke, and another four trials (involving 364 people) were eligible for our analysis of RIC for treating ischaemic stroke.

input: We also found improved success rates within two attempts (RR 1.78, 95% CI 1.25 to 2.51, 134 catheters, two RCTs, moderate-quality evidence) with ultrasound guidance compared with other types of guidance.
output: This sentence is talking about a study that was done to compare two different types of guidance when using a medical tool called a catheter. The study found that if ultrasound guidance was used, it was more successful than other types of guidance. Out of 134 catheters that were used, the success rate was 1.78 times higher when ultrasound guidance was used. This result was reliable because two different tests were done, and the evidence was of moderate quality.
gold: La ecografía también aumentó la tasa de éxito de dos intentos.
translated_output: Esta oración se refiere a un estudio que se realizó para comparar dos tipos diferentes de orientación al usar una herramienta médica llamada catéter. El estudio encontró que si se usaba guía por ultrasonido, tenía más éxito que otros tipos de guía. De los 134 catéteres que se utilizaron, la tasa de éxito fue 1,78 veces mayor cuando se utilizó la guía por ultrasonido. Este resultado fue confiable porque se realizaron dos pruebas diferentes y la evidencia fue de calidad moderada.
old_gold: Ultrasound also increased the success rate within two attempts.

input: We found low-quality evidence that RIC may reduce the risk of recurrent stroke in participants with intracerebral artery stenosis and reduce stroke severity in participants undergoing carotid stenting, but it may increase death or dependence in participants with acute ischaemic stroke who are undergoing intravenous thrombolysis.
output: This sentence is talking about a medical procedure called RIC, which might help people who had a stroke and now have a narrowed artery in their brain. This procedure might make it less likely for them to have another stroke and make their stroke less severe if they are having a procedure done to their neck artery. But, it might also make it more likely for people who just had a stroke to die or have trouble doing things for themselves.
gold: Hay evidencia de baja calidad que indica que el CIR puede ayudar a prevenir el accidente cerebrovascular recurrente en los pacientes con estrechamiento de las arterias del cerebro, y puede aumentar la muerte o la dependencia en los pacientes con accidente cerebrovascular isquémico agudo que recibieron fármacos para disolver los coágulos.
translated_output: Esta oración habla de un procedimiento médico llamado RIC, que podría ayudar a las personas que sufrieron un derrame cerebral y ahora tienen una arteria estrechada en el cerebro. Este procedimiento puede hacer que sea menos probable que tengan otro accidente cerebrovascular y que su accidente cerebrovascular sea menos grave si se someten a un procedimiento en la arteria del cuello. Pero también podría hacer que sea más probable que las personas que acaban de sufrir un derrame cerebral mueran o tengan problemas para hacer las cosas por sí mismas.
old_gold: There is low-quality evidence which suggests that RIC may help prevent recurrent stroke in people with narrowed arteries in the brain, and may increase death or dependency in people with acute ischaemic stroke who received clot dissolving medication.

input: Similarly, our results suggest, but do not confirm, the possibility of a positive influence of expertise in the use of ultrasound on the first attempt success rate.
output: Our research results hint that having more experience with ultrasound might help make it more likely to succeed the first time, but we don't have enough proof to be sure.
gold: También es probable que la ecografía sea más útil si el profesional tiene experiencia en cuanto su uso.
translated_output: Los resultados de nuestra investigación sugieren que tener más experiencia con el ultrasonido podría ayudar a que sea más probable que tenga éxito la primera vez, pero no tenemos pruebas suficientes para estar seguros.
old_gold: It is also likely that ultrasound is more useful if the practitioner is experienced in its use.

input: Our results suggest, but do not confirm, that a possible advantage of ultrasound guidance for the first attempt success rate over other techniques is more pronounced in infants and small children than in older children.
output: Our research suggests that using ultrasound to guide medical procedures is especially helpful when doing them on infants and younger children, and it may be even more helpful than other techniques. However, our research does not prove this is true.
gold: Es probable que la ecografía sea más útil para los neonatos y los niños pequeños que para los niños mayores.
translated_output: Nuestra investigación sugiere que el uso de ultrasonido para guiar los procedimientos médicos es especialmente útil cuando se los realiza en bebés y niños pequeños, y puede ser incluso más útil que otras técnicas. Sin embargo, nuestra investigación no prueba que esto sea cierto.
old_gold: It is likely that ultrasound is more useful for infants and small children than for older children.

input: In people with acute ischaemic stroke, there was no significant difference between RIC and non-RIC for reducing stroke severity as assessed by the National Institutes of Health Stroke Scale score and the final infarct volume (standardised mean difference (SMD) -0.24 mL, 95% CI -1.02 to 0.54; 2 trials, 175 participants, very low quality evidence).
output: In people who have had a stroke, there is no big difference between using a certain type of treatment (RIC) and not using it when it comes to reducing how bad the stroke is or how big the area affected by it (as measured by the National Institutes of Health Stroke Scale score and the final infarct volume).
gold: No se encontraron diferencias significativas en el tamaño del accidente cerebrovascular final.
translated_output: En las personas que han tenido un derrame cerebral, no hay una gran diferencia entre usar cierto tipo de tratamiento (RIC) y no usarlo cuando se trata de reducir la gravedad del derrame cerebral o el tamaño del área afectada por él (medido por el puntuación de la escala de accidentes cerebrovasculares de los Institutos Nacionales de la Salud y el volumen final del infarto).
old_gold: We found no significant differences in the size of the final stroke.

input: We analysed the effects of RIC on preventing and treating ischaemic stroke respectively.
output: We studied how RIC can help to stop and treat ischemic stroke.
gold: Los estudios han indicado que el CIR puede tener efectos beneficiosos en la prevención y el tratamiento del accidente cerebrovascular isquémico.
translated_output: Estudiamos cómo RIC puede ayudar a detener y tratar el accidente cerebrovascular isquémico.
old_gold: Studies have suggested that RIC may have beneficial effects for preventing and treating ischaemic stroke.

input: There was no significant difference between RIC and non-RIC for improving the psychological impairment (SMD -0.37 points, 95% CI -1.15 to 0.41; 1 trial, 26 participants, very low quality evidence) and the cognitive impairment (SMD -0.26 points; 95% CI -0.72 to 0.21; 3 trials, 79 participants, low-quality evidence) in people with acute ischaemic stroke and cerebral small vessel disease.
output: This sentence is talking about two different groups of people who had strokes: those who received a type of treatment called RIC (RIC stands for Rehabilitation Intervention in Cerebrovascular Disease) and those who did not. It is talking about how the treatment affected their psychological and cognitive health. The results showed that there was not much difference between the two groups in terms of improving the psychological and cognitive health of the people with strokes.
gold: En los pacientes con accidente cerebrovascular isquémico agudo y enfermedad crónica de los vasos sanguíneos del cerebro, el CIR no afectó las medidas de la función nerviosa, el estado de ánimo o la capacidad de pensamiento.
translated_output: Esta oración habla de dos grupos diferentes de personas que sufrieron accidentes cerebrovasculares: los que recibieron un tipo de tratamiento llamado RIC (RIC significa Intervención de rehabilitación en enfermedades cerebrovasculares) y los que no. Se trata de cómo el tratamiento afectó su salud psicológica y cognitiva. Los resultados mostraron que no hubo mucha diferencia entre los dos grupos en términos de mejorar la salud psicológica y cognitiva de las personas con accidentes cerebrovasculares.
old_gold: In people with acute ischaemic stroke and chronic blood vessel disease of the brain, RIC did not affect measures of nerve function, mood, or thinking ability.

input: Adverse events associated with RIC were significantly higher in participants treated with RIC (RR 10.91; 95% CI 2.01 to 59.28; 3 trials, 371 participants, low-quality evidence), but no severe adverse event was attributable to RIC treatment.
output: Using RIC (a certain type of treatment) caused more bad events than other treatments, but none of the bad events were very serious.
gold: Los eventos adversos fueron significativamente más frecuentes en el grupo de CIR, pero no se informó que fueran graves.
translated_output: El uso de RIC (un cierto tipo de tratamiento) causó más eventos malos que otros tratamientos, pero ninguno de los eventos malos fue muy grave.
old_gold: Adverse events were significantly more common in the RIC group but were not reported to be severe.

input: Risk of bias varied across studies, with some studies lacking details of allocation concealment.
output: The amount of risk that the results of the studies could be influenced by something other than the facts was different for each study. Some studies didn't give enough information to make sure that people couldn't see which group the participants were in.
gold: Se observaron variaciones en el riesgo de sesgo de los estudios incluidos.
translated_output: La cantidad de riesgo de que los resultados de los estudios pudieran estar influenciados por algo diferente a los hechos fue diferente para cada estudio. Algunos estudios no brindaron suficiente información para asegurarse de que las personas no pudieran ver en qué grupo estaban los participantes.
old_gold: We noted variation in the risk of bias of included studies.

input: There were no serious adverse events related to either nitrous oxide or carbon dioxide pneumoperitoneum (three studies; 196 participants; very low quality of evidence).
output: The three studies done with 196 people showed that there were no bad effects from breathing either nitrogen gas or carbon dioxide gas during a medical procedure.
gold: No está claro si existen o no diferencias en el número de personas con complicaciones cardiopulmonares (corazón y pulmones) o complicaciones quirúrgicas entre el dióxido de carbono y el óxido nitroso.
translated_output: Los tres estudios realizados con 196 personas mostraron que no hubo efectos negativos al respirar gas nitrógeno o dióxido de carbono durante un procedimiento médico.
old_gold: We are uncertain as to whether there are differences in the number of people with heart or lung complications or surgical complications between nitrous oxide and carbon dioxide.

input: Pressure ulcers, also known as bed sores, pressure sores or decubitus ulcers develop as a result of a localised injury to the skin or underlying tissue, or both.
output: Pressure ulcers are a type of sore that can form on your skin when you stay in one position for too long. They can be very painful and can cause damage to your skin and the tissue underneath it.
gold: Las úlceras por presión también se conocen como escaras, lesiones por presión o úlceras de decúbito.
translated_output: Las úlceras por presión son un tipo de llaga que se puede formar en la piel cuando permanece demasiado tiempo en una misma posición. Pueden ser muy dolorosos y pueden dañar la piel y el tejido debajo de ella.
old_gold: Pressure ulcers are also known as bed sores, pressure sores or decubitus ulcers.

input: Randomized controlled trials based on uniform and standard methods are needed.
output: Scientists need to do experiments using the same rules and methods so they can compare results.
gold: Se necesitan más investigaciones y estudios bien diseñados.
translated_output: Los científicos necesitan hacer experimentos usando las mismas reglas y métodos para poder comparar los resultados.
old_gold: Further research and well-designed studies are needed.

input: There is qualitative evidence that oral morphine has much the same efficacy as other available opioids.
output: Studies have shown that taking oral morphine is just as effective at treating pain as other types of medicine used to treat pain.
gold: Por un lado, estos son buenos resultados.
translated_output: Los estudios han demostrado que tomar morfina oral es tan efectivo para tratar el dolor como otros tipos de medicamentos que se usan para tratar el dolor.
old_gold: At one level these are good results.

input: To assess the benefits and harms of RIC for preventing ischaemic stroke and for treating people with ischaemic stroke and those at risk for ischaemic stroke.
output: This sentence is asking us to find out if a certain type of medical treatment (RIC) is helpful in preventing and treating strokes. We want to know if the benefits of using RIC are greater than the risks.
gold: ¿Cuáles son los efectos beneficiosos del uso del condicionamiento isquémico remoto (una fisioterapia no invasiva que incluye inflar manguitos de presión arterial para reducir el flujo sanguíneo en los brazos y las piernas y luego liberar la sangre afectada hacia todo el cuerpo) en los pacientes con accidente cerebrovascular o en los que tienen riesgo de accidente cerebrovascular causado por la reducción del flujo sanguíneo?
translated_output: Esta oración nos pide que averigüemos si cierto tipo de tratamiento médico (RIC, por sus siglas en inglés) es útil para prevenir y tratar los accidentes cerebrovasculares. Queremos saber si los beneficios de usar RIC son mayores que los riesgos.
old_gold: What are the benefits of using remote ischaemic conditioning (a noninvasive physical therapy that involves inflating blood pressure cuffs to reduce blood flow in arms and legs, and then releasing the affected blood around the body) in people with stroke or those at risk of stroke caused by low blood flow?

input: Our results suggest, but do not confirm, that a possible advantage of ultrasound guidance for the first attempt success rate over other techniques is more pronounced in infants and small children than in older children.
output: Our research suggests that using ultrasound to guide medical procedures is especially helpful when doing them on infants and younger children, and it may be even more helpful than other techniques. However, our research does not prove this is true.
gold: Es probable que la ecografía sea más útil para los neonatos y los niños pequeños que para los niños mayores.
translated_output: Nuestra investigación sugiere que el uso de ultrasonido para guiar los procedimientos médicos es especialmente útil cuando se los realiza en bebés y niños pequeños, y puede ser incluso más útil que otras técnicas. Sin embargo, nuestra investigación no prueba que esto sea cierto.
old_gold: It is likely that ultrasound is more useful for infants and small children than for older children.

input: Where results were reported for individual participants in 17 studies, 'no worse than mild pain' was achieved by 96% of participants (362/377), and an outcome equivalent to treatment success in 63% (400/638).
output: Out of the 17 studies that reported individual results, 96% of participants (362 out of 377) reported no more than mild pain, and 63% (400 out of 638) reported that their treatment was successful.
gold: Más de nueve de cada diez participantes presentaron dolor que pasó de moderado o intenso antes de tomar morfina a dolor que no fue peor que el leve al tomar morfina.
translated_output: De los 17 estudios que informaron resultados individuales, el 96 % de los participantes (362 de 377) informaron dolor leve y el 63 % (400 de 638) informaron que su tratamiento fue exitoso.
old_gold: More than 9 in 10 participants had pain that went from moderate or severe before taking morphine to pain that was no worse than mild when taking morphine.

input: We searched the Cochrane Kidney and Transplant Specialised Register up to 17 August 2017 through contact with the Information Specialist using search terms relevant to this review.
output: We asked an expert to help us look for information about a certain topic in a special database. We looked through the database until August 17, 2017, using words that were related to our topic.
gold: ¿Qué se hizo? Se realizaron búsquedas en el Registro Especializado Cochrane de Riñón y Trasplante hasta el 17 de agosto de 2017 y se realizó una revisión sistemática de los estudios realizados en pacientes con catéteres de hemodiálisis disfuncionales y se comparó el éxito de los agentes trombolíticos, la eliminación de la vaina de fibrina y el reemplazo de la línea. ¿Qué se encontró?
translated_output: Le pedimos a un experto que nos ayudara a buscar información sobre un tema determinado en una base de datos especial. Revisamos la base de datos hasta el 17 de agosto de 2017, usando palabras relacionadas con nuestro tema.
old_gold: We searched Cochrane Kidney and Transplant's Specialised Register up to 17 August 2017 and performed a systematic review of studies performed in patients with dysfunctional haemodialysis catheters and compared the success of thrombolytic agents, fibrin sheath stripping and line replacement.

input: Early and rapid emergence from anaesthesia is desirable for most neurosurgical patients.
output: It is best for patients who have had surgery on their brain if they wake up from the medicine that makes them go to sleep quickly and easily.
gold: El despertar tranquilo y rápido después de la cirugía es importante en estos pacientes para que el estado mental se pueda evaluar fácilmente.
translated_output: Lo mejor para los pacientes que se han sometido a una cirugía en el cerebro es que se despierten del medicamento que los hace dormir rápida y fácilmente.
old_gold: Smooth and quick awakening after surgery is important for these patients so that their mental status may be assessed easily.

input: The improved success rate at the first attempt may be more pronounced in infants and small children, in whom arterial line cannulation is more challenging than in older children.
output: The chance of being successful the first time is higher in babies and younger children than in older children when doctors try to put a tube into their artery. This is because it is harder to do in babies and younger children.
gold: Se encontró que la ecografía aumentó la tasa de canulación exitosa al primer intento y redujo la formación de hematomas.
translated_output: La probabilidad de tener éxito la primera vez es mayor en bebés y niños más pequeños que en niños mayores cuando los médicos intentan colocar un tubo en la arteria. Esto se debe a que es más difícil hacerlo en bebés y niños pequeños.
old_gold: We found that ultrasound increased the rate of successful cannulation at the first attempt and reduced the formation of haematomas.

input: Pooled analyses for adverse events suggest lower risk of nausea and vomiting with propofol than with sevoflurane (risk ratio (RR) 0.68, 95% CI 0.51 to 0.91, low-quality evidence) or isoflurane (RR 0.45, 95% CI 0.26 to 0.78) and greater risk of haemodynamic changes with propofol than with sevoflurane (RR 1.85, 95% CI 1.07 to 3.17), but no differences in the risk of shivering or pain.
output: The results of many studies show that propofol is less likely to cause nausea or vomiting than sevoflurane, but is more likely to cause changes in the body's blood pressure than sevoflurane. There is no difference between propofol and sevoflurane when it comes to shivering or pain.
gold: En cuanto a los efectos adversos, el propofol tuvo menores probabilidades de provocar náuseas y vómitos que el anestésico gaseoso (cerca de la mitad de las probabilidades), pero fue más probable que se asociara con cambios en la presión arterial.
translated_output: Los resultados de muchos estudios muestran que es menos probable que el propofol cause náuseas o vómitos que el sevoflurano, pero es más probable que cause cambios en la presión arterial del cuerpo que el sevoflurano. No hay diferencia entre propofol y sevoflurano cuando se trata de escalofríos o dolor.
old_gold: In terms of adverse effects, propofol was less likely to cause nausea and vomiting than either gas anaesthetic (about half as likely) but was more likely to be associated with changes in blood pressure.

input: Evidence from one trial of small sample size suggests that room air pneumoperitoneum may decrease hospital costs in people undergoing laparoscopic abdominal surgery.
output: This sentence is talking about a study that looked at a small group of people who had laparoscopic abdominal surgery, which is a type of operation done on the abdomen. The study found that using room air instead of a special gas during the operation may help to reduce the amount of money spent on the surgery.
gold: El aire ambiental parecía estar asociado con menores costos totales de hospitalización en comparación con el dióxido de carbono para la insuflación de la cavidad abdominal.
translated_output: Esta oración se refiere a un estudio que analizó a un pequeño grupo de personas que se sometieron a una cirugía abdominal laparoscópica, que es un tipo de operación que se realiza en el abdomen. El estudio encontró que el uso de aire ambiental en lugar de un gas especial durante la operación puede ayudar a reducir la cantidad de dinero gastado en la cirugía.
old_gold: Room air seemed to be associated with lower total hospital costs compared with carbon dioxide for insufflation of the abdominal cavity.

input: We reran the searches for all databases in March 2016, and when we update the review, we will deal with the two studies of interest found through this search that are awaiting classification.
output: We looked through all the different databases in March 2016, and when we look at the information again, we will decide what to do about two studies we found that we don't know enough about yet.
gold: Se volvieron a ejecutar las búsquedas para todas las bases de datos en marzo 2016 y se encontraron dos estudios que están en espera de clasificación.
translated_output: Revisamos todas las diferentes bases de datos en marzo de 2016, y cuando volvamos a mirar la información, decidiremos qué hacer con dos estudios que descubrimos sobre los que aún no sabemos lo suficiente.
old_gold: We reran the searches for all databases in March 2016 and found two studies that are awaiting classification.

input: Three trials randomised participants to nitrous oxide pneumoperitoneum (100 participants) or carbon dioxide pneumoperitoneum (96 participants).
output: This sentence describes a scientific experiment that tested two different types of medical treatments on two groups of people. The first group had 100 people and they were given a treatment with nitrous oxide. The second group had 96 people and they were given a treatment with carbon dioxide.
gold: Se identificaron nueve ensayos clínicos con 519 participantes, de los cuales tres ensayos (196 participantes) compararon el óxido nitroso (gas de la risa) con el dióxido de carbono, cinco ensayos (177 participantes) compararon el helio con el dióxido de carbono y un ensayo (146 participantes) comparó el aire ambiental con el dióxido de carbono.
translated_output: Esta oración describe un experimento científico que probó dos tipos diferentes de tratamientos médicos en dos grupos de personas. El primer grupo tenía 100 personas y se les dio un tratamiento con óxido nitroso. El segundo grupo tenía 96 personas y se les dio un tratamiento con dióxido de carbono.
old_gold: We identified nine clinical trials with 519 participants, of which three trials (196 participants) compared nitrous oxide (laughing gas) with carbon dioxide, five trials (177 participants) compared helium with carbon dioxide, and one trial (146 participants) compared room air with carbon dioxide.

input: There is no high quality evidence to support the use of anabolic steroids in treating pressure ulcers.
output: There is not enough good proof to show that using anabolic steroids can help people with pressure ulcers.
gold: El ensayo finalizó temprano, ya que los autores del ensayo consideraron que los resultados provisionales indicaron que fue poco probable que hubiera un efecto beneficioso a partir del tratamiento con oxandrolona.
translated_output: No hay pruebas suficientes que demuestren que el uso de esteroides anabólicos puede ayudar a las personas con úlceras por presión.
old_gold: The trial was ended early as the trial authors deemed that the interim results suggested that there was unlikely to be a benefit from treatment with oxandrolone.

input: The quality of the current evidence is very low.
output: The information we have now is not very good.
gold: En general, la calidad de la evidencia para los resultados es muy baja.
translated_output: La información que tenemos ahora no es muy buena.
old_gold: Overall, the quality of the evidence for the results is very low.

input: Pressure ulcers, also known as bed sores, pressure sores or decubitus ulcers develop as a result of a localised injury to the skin or underlying tissue, or both.
output: A pressure ulcer is when your skin gets hurt from staying in the same place for too long. It is also sometimes called a bed sore, pressure sore, or decubitus ulcer. These kinds of skin injuries happen when you are not able to move around and change positions.
gold: La falta de movimiento y la presión mantenida sobre la piel que cubre partes óseas del cuerpo como las caderas, los talones, la región lumbar y los codos pueden causar que la piel se rompa y se forme una úlcera.
translated_output: Una úlcera por presión es cuando la piel se lastima por permanecer demasiado tiempo en el mismo lugar. A veces también se le llama úlcera de decúbito, úlcera de decúbito o úlcera de decúbito. Este tipo de lesiones en la piel ocurren cuando no puede moverse ni cambiar de posición.
old_gold: Lack of movement and sustained pressure on the skin over bony parts of the body such as the hips, heels, lower back and elbows can cause the skin to break down and an ulcer to form.

input: Pain relief did not differ between Mm/r and MIR.
output: The amount of pain relief that both Mm/r and MIR provided was the same.
gold: lo cual dificultó la posibilidad de determinar si algún comprimido o preparado oral con morfina fue mejor que otro.
translated_output: La cantidad de alivio del dolor que proporcionaron tanto Mm/r como MIR fue la misma.
old_gold: This made it difficult to work out whether any one tablet or preparation of oral morphine was better than any other.

input: In people with carotid stenosis undergoing carotid stenting, there was no significant difference in the incidence of ischaemic stroke between participants treated with RIC and non-RIC (RR 0.22, 95% CI 0.01 to 4.03; 1 trial, 189 participants, low-quality evidence); however the stroke severity (assessed by infarct volume) was significantly lower in participants treated with RIC (mean difference (MD) -0.17 mL, 95% CI -0.23 to -0.11; 1 trial, 189 participants, low-quality evidence).
output: People with carotid stenosis (a narrowed artery in the neck) had a medical procedure called carotid stenting. In this procedure, some people received a special treatment called RIC (Remote Ischemic Conditioning). The study showed that there was no big difference in the number of people who had a stroke after the procedure between those who received RIC and those who did not. However, the study did show that people who received RIC had less severe strokes than those who did not receive RIC.
gold: En los pacientes que reciben tratamiento de colocación de un stent (inserción de un tubo metálico o plástico) por el estrechamiento de las arterias del cuello, el CIR puede reducir el tamaño de las nuevas lesiones cerebrales causadas por la reducción del flujo sanguíneo.
translated_output: Las personas con estenosis carotídea (una arteria estrechada en el cuello) se sometieron a un procedimiento médico llamado colocación de stent carotídeo. En este procedimiento, algunas personas recibieron un tratamiento especial llamado RIC (Remote Ischemic Conditioning). El estudio mostró que no hubo una gran diferencia en la cantidad de personas que sufrieron un accidente cerebrovascular después del procedimiento entre las que recibieron RIC y las que no. Sin embargo, el estudio mostró que las personas que recibieron RIC tuvieron accidentes cerebrovasculares menos graves que las que no recibieron RIC.
old_gold: In people being treated with stenting (the insertion of a metal or plastic tube) for narrowed arteries in the neck, RIC may reduce the size of new brain injuries caused by reduced blood flow.

input: Thrombolysis, fibrin sheath disruption and over-the-wire catheter exchange are effective and appropriate therapies for immediately restoring catheter patency in dysfunctional cuffed and tunnelled HD catheters.
output: Thrombolysis, fibrin sheath disruption, and exchanging a catheter over a wire are good ways to quickly fix a catheter that isn't working properly in a person who has a cuffed and tunneled (covered) catheter in their body.
gold: El tratamiento trombolítico probablemente fue mejor que el placebo para restaurar la función del catéter aunque no hubo una dosis ni un método de administración óptimos.
translated_output: La trombólisis, la interrupción de la vaina de fibrina y el cambio de un catéter por un alambre son buenas formas de reparar rápidamente un catéter que no funciona correctamente en una persona que tiene un catéter con manguito y tunelizado (cubierto) en el cuerpo.
old_gold: Thrombolytic therapy was probably better than placebo at restoring catheter function but there was no optimal dose or administration method.

input: Modified release versions of morphine were effective for 12- or 24-hour dosing depending on the formulation.
output: Morphine is a medicine that can be taken in a special form that helps people feel better for 12 or 24 hours depending on how it is made.
gold: Hay comprimidos de liberación modificada que liberan morfina más lentamente, para que puedan administrarse solo dos veces al día o incluso una.
translated_output: La morfina es un medicamento que se puede tomar en una forma especial que ayuda a las personas a sentirse mejor durante 12 o 24 horas, según cómo se elabore.
old_gold: Modified release tablets are available that release morphine more slowly, so that they can be taken only twice a day or even only once a day.

input: To assess the effects of intravenous versus inhalational techniques for rapid emergence from anaesthesia in patients undergoing brain tumour surgery.
output: Doctors want to find out if it is better to give medicine to patients through a needle in the vein or through breathing in medicine to help them wake up quickly after surgery to remove a brain tumor.
gold: Se intentó determinar si las técnicas inyectables fueron mejores o peores que las técnicas gaseosas.
translated_output: Los médicos quieren saber si es mejor administrar medicamentos a los pacientes a través de una aguja en la vena o mediante la inhalación de medicamentos para ayudarlos a despertarse rápidamente después de la cirugía para extirpar un tumor cerebral.
old_gold: We aimed to discover whether injectable techniques were better or worse than gaseous techniques.

input: There were three serious adverse events (subcutaneous emphysema) related to helium pneumoperitoneum (three studies; 128 participants; very low quality of evidence).
output: Three studies with 128 participants showed that serious health problems happened to some people when they had a procedure that involved helium gas being pumped into their stomach. The evidence of this happening was not very strong.
gold: Hubo tres efectos secundarios graves con el uso de helio.
translated_output: Tres estudios con 128 participantes mostraron que algunas personas tenían problemas de salud graves cuando se sometían a un procedimiento en el que se bombeaba gas helio en el estómago. La evidencia de que esto sucediera no era muy fuerte.
old_gold: There were three serious side effects when helium was used.

input: Preclinical studies have suggested that RIC may have beneficial effects in ischaemic stroke patients and those at risk of ischaemic stroke.
output: Medical research has shown that a certain type of treatment called RIC may help people who have had a stroke or are at risk of having a stroke.
gold: Los estudios han indicado que el CIR puede tener efectos beneficiosos en la prevención y el tratamiento del accidente cerebrovascular isquémico.
translated_output: La investigación médica ha demostrado que cierto tipo de tratamiento llamado RIC puede ayudar a las personas que han tenido un derrame cerebral o que corren el riesgo de sufrir un derrame cerebral.
old_gold: Studies have suggested that RIC may have beneficial effects for preventing and treating ischaemic stroke.

input: Based on the available evidence, physical disruption of a fibrin sheath using interventional radiology techniques appears to be equally efficacious as the use of a pharmaceutical thrombolytic agent for the immediate management of dysfunctional catheters (57 participants: RR 0.92, 95% CI 0.80 to 1.07).
output: Using a special medical technique (interventional radiology) to break apart a fibrin sheath seems to work just as well as using medicine (a thrombolytic agent) to help fix catheters that are not working properly. 57 people were studied and the results showed that the two methods were equally effective.
gold: La alteración física de una vaina de fibrina puede tener la misma efectividad que el agente trombolítico farmacéutico para el tratamiento inmediato de la disfunción del catéter.
translated_output: El uso de una técnica médica especial (radiología intervencionista) para romper una vaina de fibrina parece funcionar tan bien como el uso de medicamentos (un agente trombolítico) para ayudar a reparar los catéteres que no funcionan correctamente. Se estudiaron 57 personas y los resultados mostraron que los dos métodos eran igualmente efectivos.
old_gold: Physical disruption of a fibrin sheath may be equally effective as pharmaceutical thrombolytic agent for immediate management of catheter dysfunction.

input: We analysed the effects of RIC on preventing and treating ischaemic stroke respectively.
output: We studied how RIC can help to stop and treat ischemic stroke.
gold: Los estudios han indicado que el CIR puede tener efectos beneficiosos en la prevención y el tratamiento del accidente cerebrovascular isquémico.
translated_output: Estudiamos cómo RIC puede ayudar a detener y tratar el accidente cerebrovascular isquémico.
old_gold: Studies have suggested that RIC may have beneficial effects for preventing and treating ischaemic stroke.

input: Anabolic steroids are considered because of their ability to stimulate protein synthesis and build muscle mass.
output: Anabolic steroids are used by some people because they are believed to help build muscles and increase the amount of protein in the body.
gold: Se piensa que promueven el crecimiento del músculo esquelético y restauran la masa muscular, lo que podría ayudar en la cicatrización de las úlceras por presión.
translated_output: Algunas personas usan esteroides anabólicos porque se cree que ayudan a desarrollar los músculos y aumentan la cantidad de proteína en el cuerpo.
old_gold: They are thought to promote the growth of skeletal muscle and to restore muscle mass, which could help pressure ulcers to heal.

input: Pain relief did not differ between Mm/r and MIR.
output: The amount of relief from pain was the same with Mm/r and MIR.
gold: No parecieron ser muy diferentes entre sí.
translated_output: La cantidad de alivio del dolor fue la misma con Mm/r y MIR.
old_gold: There did not seem to be much difference between them.

input: Brain tumour surgery usually is carried out with the patient under general anaesthesia.
output: Brain tumor surgery is usually done while the patient is asleep. The doctor gives the patient medicine to make them sleep so they can't feel the surgery.
gold: La cirugía por un tumor cerebral se realiza con mayor frecuencia con el paciente dormido y se utilizan agentes inyectables o gases.
translated_output: La cirugía de tumor cerebral generalmente se realiza mientras el paciente está dormido. El médico le da al paciente un medicamento para que se duerma y no sienta la cirugía.
old_gold: Brain tumour surgery is carried out most often with the patient asleep and with the use of injectable agents or gases.

input: We included 15 RCTs with 1833 participants.
output: We found 15 studies that involved 1833 people to see if a certain treatment works.

old_gold: We found 15 eligible studies with 1833 participants.

input: Moderate evidence showed that the fibrate class can be effective in the secondary prevention of composite outcome of non-fatal stroke, non-fatal MI, and vascular death.
output: Studies showed that taking a type of medicine called "fibrate" can help to prevent strokes, heart attacks, and death caused by blood vessels.
gold: En combinación con los datos del clofibrato, la calidad de la evidencia fue moderada para el resultado compuesto (accidente cerebrovascular no mortal, infarto de miocardio [IM] no mortal y muerte por causa vascular) y el resultado IM (no mortal o mortal) y baja para el accidente cerebrovascular (isquémico o hemorrágico, no mortal o mortal) y la muerte por causa vascular o por cualquier causa durante el tratamiento y el período de seguimiento programado.
translated_output: Los estudios demostraron que tomar un tipo de medicamento llamado "fibrato" puede ayudar a prevenir derrames cerebrales, ataques cardíacos y la muerte causada por los vasos sanguíneos.
old_gold: In combination with clofibrate data, quality of evidence was moderate for the composite (non-fatal stroke, non-fatal myocardial infarction (MI), and vascular death) and MI (non-fatal or fatal) outcomes and low for stroke (ischaemic or haemorrhagic, non-fatal or fatal) and death from vascular or any cause during the treatment and scheduled follow-up period.

input: Interventions included: thrombolytic therapy versus placebo (1 study); low versus high dose thrombolytic therapy (1); alteplase versus urokinase (1); short versus long thrombolytic dwell (1); thrombolytic therapy versus percutaneous fibrin sheath stripping (1); fibrin sheath stripping versus over-the-wire catheter exchange (1); and over-the-wire catheter exchange versus exchange with and without angioplasty sheath disruption (1).
output: This sentence is talking about different treatments for a medical condition. It lists seven different treatments, and then explains what each treatment is comparing. output: Therefore, scientists are looking for new gases that can be used instead of carbon dioxide to make a person's abdomen full of air.

input: On current data there is no evidence to support physical intervention over the use of pharmaceutical agents in the acute setting.
output: Based on what we know now, there is not enough evidence to show that it is better to use physical methods instead of medicine to treat someone in an emergency situation.
gold: Actualmente hay evidencia insuficiente a favor de cualquier técnica en cuanto a la adecuación de la diálisis o el riesgo reducido de eventos adversos.
translated_output: Según lo que sabemos ahora, no hay suficiente evidencia para demostrar que es mejor usar métodos físicos en lugar de medicamentos para tratar a alguien en una situación de emergencia.
old_gold: There is currently insufficient evidence favouring any technique in terms of either dialysis adequacy or reduced risk of adverse events.

input: Indigenous youth in particular commence smoking at an early age, and a disproportionate burden of substance-related morbidity and mortality exists as a result.
output: Young people who are from the original or earliest known inhabitants of an area, often start smoking earlier than other people, and this leads to more health problems and death than what is normal.
gold: Los daños asociados a la salud son inadmisibles.
translated_output: Los jóvenes que son de los habitantes originales o más antiguos conocidos de un área, a menudo comienzan a fumar antes que otras personas, y esto conduce a más problemas de salud y muerte de lo normal.
old_gold: The associated harms to health are unacceptable.

input: The adverse events most commonly reported were mild and transient such as skin irritation, itching, burning, and stinging.
output: The most common side effects of this medicine were not serious. They were things like skin irritation, itching, burning, and stinging, but they were usually mild and did not last very long.
gold: Los efectos secundarios informados con mayor frecuencia por los participantes y los médicos fueron sequedad, enrojecimiento e hipersensibilidad de la piel.
translated_output: Los efectos secundarios más comunes de este medicamento no fueron graves. Eran cosas como irritación de la piel, picazón, ardor y escozor, pero por lo general eran leves y no duraban mucho.
old_gold: The side-effects reported most frequently by both participants and clinicians were dry, red, and sore skin.

input: For smokeless tobacco use, no difference was found between the skills-community arm and the control group at 42 weeks (RR 0.93, 95% CI 0.67 to 1.30), though a significant difference was observed between the skills-only arm and the control group (RR 0.57, 95% CI 0.39 to 0.85).
output: This sentence is talking about a study that looked at the effects of using smokeless tobacco. The study found that there was no difference between the group of people who learned skills to help them not use smokeless tobacco and the group of people who did not get any help, after 42 weeks. But the study did find a difference between the group that only learned skills and the group that did not get any help; the group that only learned skills were less likely to use smokeless tobacco than the group that did not get any help.
gold: Esta revisión halló que no existe investigación publicada que evalúe los programas orientados a evitar que los jóvenes indígenas no consuman tabaco. La información de dos estudios incluidos en esta revisión (1505 participantes en total, en comunidades de nativos americanos) no permite realizar una conclusión sobre si los programas de prevención del consumo de tabaco en las poblaciones indígenas evitan que los jóvenes consuman tabaco con o sin humo.
translated_output: Esta oración se refiere a un estudio que analizó los efectos del uso de tabaco sin humo. El estudio encontró que no hubo diferencia entre el grupo de personas que aprendieron habilidades para ayudarlos a no usar tabaco sin humo y el grupo de personas que no recibieron ninguna ayuda, después de 42 semanas. Pero el estudio encontró una diferencia entre el grupo que solo aprendió habilidades y el grupo que no recibió ayuda; el grupo que solo aprendió habilidades tenía menos probabilidades de usar tabaco sin humo que el grupo que no recibió ayuda.
old_gold: Information from the two included studies in this review (1505 participants in total, in Native American communities) does not allow a conclusion to be drawn as to whether tobacco prevention programmes in Indigenous populations prevent Indigenous youth from smoking or using smokeless tobacco.

input: Preclinical studies have suggested that RIC may have beneficial effects in ischaemic stroke patients and those at risk of ischaemic stroke.
output: Medical research has shown that a certain type of treatment called RIC may help people who have had a stroke or are at risk of having a stroke.
gold: Los estudios han indicado que el CIR puede tener efectos beneficiosos en la prevención y el tratamiento del accidente cerebrovascular isquémico.
translated_output: La investigación médica ha demostrado que cierto tipo de tratamiento llamado RIC puede ayudar a las personas que han tenido un derrame cerebral o que corren el riesgo de sufrir un derrame cerebral.
old_gold: Studies have suggested that RIC may have beneficial effects for preventing and treating ischaemic stroke.

input: Smoking prevalence in Indigenous youth is twice that of the non-Indigenous population, with tobacco experimentation commencing at an early age.
output: Indigenous (Native American) young people smoke twice as much as people who are not Native American, and they start trying cigarettes at a very young age.
gold: Los jóvenes permanecen en riesgo de comenzar a fumar.
translated_output: Los jóvenes indígenas (nativos americanos) fuman el doble que las personas que no son nativos americanos, y empiezan a probar los cigarrillos a una edad muy temprana.
old_gold: Young people remain at particular risk of taking up smoking.

input: As an attempt to avoid possible detrimental effects on the oocytes from long exposure to sperm, the brief co-incubation insemination protocol was developed.
output: Scientists developed a special way of insemination to help prevent the eggs from being damaged from being around sperm for too long.
gold: El acortamiento del tiempo de coincubación de los ovocitos y los espermatozoides pudiera mejorar los resultados de la FIV al reducir el efecto perjudicial de las EOR sobre los cigotos y la calidad de los embriones.
translated_output: Los científicos desarrollaron una forma especial de inseminación para ayudar a evitar que los óvulos se dañen por estar cerca de los espermatozoides durante demasiado tiempo.
old_gold: Shortening the co-incubation time of oocytes and sperm may possibly improve IVF outcomes by reducing the detrimental effect of ROS on the zygotes and the quality of the embryos.

input: We searched until January 2016.
output: We looked for something until the end of January 2016.
gold: La evidencia está actualizada hasta enero 2016.
translated_output: Buscamos algo hasta finales de enero de 2016.
old_gold: The evidence is current to January 2016.

input: A similar pattern was seen for DBP: three trials found a reduction in DBP (reductions ranged from -12.2 mmHg (95% CI -15.8 to -8.7) to -4.43 mmHg (95% CI -7.14 to -1.72)) and three trials found no clear evidence of a difference, however again with wide CIs.
output: In this study, there were three tests where people had a decrease in the amount of a certain type of blood pressure. The decrease ranged from -12.2 to -4.43. In the other three tests, there was no clear evidence of a change, but the results were uncertain.
gold: Debido al escaso número de estudios a corto plazo y la variabilidad entre ellos, no fue posible determinar de manera concluyente si el tai chi fue beneficioso para reducir el riesgo cardiovascular en los adultos sanos y los adultos con mayor riesgo de EC, aunque en algunos estudios se observaron efectos beneficiosos sobre los factores de riesgo de EC.
translated_output: En este estudio, hubo tres pruebas en las que las personas tuvieron una disminución en la cantidad de cierto tipo de presión arterial. La disminución osciló entre -12,2 y -4,43. En las otras tres pruebas, no hubo evidencia clara de un cambio, pero los resultados fueron inciertos.
old_gold: Due to the small number of short-term studies and the variability between them, we were unable to determine conclusively whether or not tai chi was beneficial at reducing cardiovascular risk in healthy adults and adults at increased risk of CVD, although beneficial effects for CVD risk factors were seen in some studies.

input: Eight RCTs with 733 women in total that compared brief co-incubation and the standard insemination protocol were included.
output: Eight studies were done on 733 women to see if a different way of helping a woman get pregnant (called "brief co-incubation") works better than the usual way (called "the standard insemination protocol").
gold: En esta revisión se identificaron ocho ensayos controlados aleatorios con 733 mujeres.
translated_output: Se realizaron ocho estudios en 733 mujeres para ver si una forma diferente de ayudar a una mujer a quedar embarazada (llamada "coincubación breve") funciona mejor que la forma habitual (llamada "protocolo de inseminación estándar").
old_gold: This review identified eight randomized controlled trials involving 733 women.

input: We included all randomised clinical trials comparing box model trainers versus no training in surgical trainees with no prior laparoscopic experience.
output: We studied different types of surgical training to find out if it was helpful for people who had never done laparoscopic surgery before. We looked at people who used a type of practice called box model training and people who did not use any training.
gold: Los ensayos compararon el entrenamiento con simulador versus ningún entrenamiento (16 ensayos; 464 participantes) o versus diferentes tipos de entrenamiento con simulador (14 ensayos; 382 participantes) (algunos ensayos y participantes se incluyeron en ambas comparaciones debido a que los ensayos comparaban diferentes métodos de entrenamiento con simulador versus ningún entrenamiento).
translated_output: Estudiamos diferentes tipos de capacitación quirúrgica para averiguar si era útil para las personas que nunca antes habían realizado una cirugía laparoscópica. Observamos a personas que usaron un tipo de práctica llamada entrenamiento de modelo de caja y personas que no usaron ningún entrenamiento.
old_gold: The trials compared box model training versus no training (16 trials; 464 participants) or versus different types of box model training (14 trials; 382 participants) (some trials and participants were included in both comparisons as the trials compared different methods of box training versus no training).

input: We located 10 RCTs involving 2961 participating surgeons performing an operation in which the use of blunt needles was compared to the use of sharp needles.
output: This sentence is talking about a study that looked at 10 different groups of doctors who all did the same kind of surgery. In the study, they compared two different types of needles that the doctors used. One type of needle was "blunt" and the other type was "sharp". In total, 2961 doctors took part in the study.
gold: Se localizaron diez ECA con 2961 cirugías en las que las agujas con punta roma se compararon con las agujas afiladas.
translated_output: Esta oración se refiere a un estudio que analizó a 10 grupos diferentes de médicos que realizaron el mismo tipo de cirugía. En el estudio, compararon dos tipos diferentes de agujas que usaron los médicos. Un tipo de aguja era "romo" y el otro tipo era "afilado". En total, 2961 médicos participaron en el estudio.
old_gold: We located 10 RCTs with 2961 operations in which blunt needles were compared to sharp needles.

input: To assess interventions used in the management of all types of melasma: epidermal, dermal, and mixed.
output: To figure out which treatments work best for melasma, which is a type of skin discoloration, we need to look at different kinds of melasma, like ones that are on the outer layer of the skin and ones that are deeper.
gold: El melasma epidérmico es el más superficial con un aumento del pigmento de la piel (melanina) en la capa superior de la piel (epidermis).
translated_output: Para determinar qué tratamientos funcionan mejor para el melasma, que es un tipo de decoloración de la piel, debemos observar diferentes tipos de melasma, como los que se encuentran en la capa externa de la piel y los que son más profundos.
old_gold: Epidermal melasma is the most superficial with an increase in the skin pigment (melanin) in the top layer of skin (epidermis).

input: We included three trials (involving 371 participants) in the analysis of the effects of RIC on ischaemic stroke prevention.
output: We looked at the effects of RIC on preventing strokes by running experiments with 371 people. We used the results of these experiments to help us understand the effects of RIC.
gold: Tres ensayos (que incluyeron 371 pacientes) fueron elegibles para el análisis del CIR para la prevención del accidente cerebrovascular isquémico, y otros cuatro ensayos (que incluyeron 364 pacientes) fueron elegibles para el análisis del CIR para el tratamiento del accidente cerebrovascular isquémico.
translated_output: Observamos los efectos de RIC en la prevención de accidentes cerebrovasculares realizando experimentos con 371 personas. Usamos los resultados de estos experimentos para ayudarnos a comprender los efectos de RIC.
old_gold: Three trials (involving 371 people) were eligible for our analysis of RIC for preventing ischaemic stroke, and another four trials (involving 364 people) were eligible for our analysis of RIC for treating ischaemic stroke.

input: They can be grouped into those including a bleaching agent such as hydroquinone, triple-combination creams (hydroquinone, tretinoin, and fluocinolone acetonide), and combination therapies (hydroquinone cream and glycolic acid peels), as well as less conventional therapies including rucinol, vitamin C iontophoresis, and skin-lightening complexes like Thiospot and Gigawhite.

input: Because the force needed for the blunt needles is higher, their use was rated as more difficult but still acceptable in five out of six studies.
output: Blunt needles are not easy to use, but in most studies, people said that it was okay.
gold: Aunque los cirujanos informaran que la fuerza que se debe ejercer con las agujas con punta roma es mayor, su uso se consideró aun así aceptable en cinco de cada seis estudios.
translated_output: Las agujas romas no son fáciles de usar, pero en la mayoría de los estudios, las personas dijeron que estaba bien.
old_gold: Even though surgeons reported that the force needed for the blunt needles was higher, their use of the needles was still rated as acceptable in five out of six studies.

input: There appears to be no significant differences in the improvement of technical skills between different methods of box model training.
output: There does not seem to be much difference in how well people get better at using box models when using different methods of training.
gold: No parece haber diferencias significativas en los diferentes métodos de entrenamiento con simulador.
translated_output: No parece haber mucha diferencia en qué tan bien las personas mejoran en el uso de modelos de caja cuando usan diferentes métodos de entrenamiento.
old_gold: There does not appear to be any significant differences in different methods of box model training.

input: The rates were 24.5 for the sponge and 10.9 for the diaphragm in the UK trial.
output: In the UK trial, it cost 24.5 pounds to buy a sponge and 10.9 pounds to buy a diaphragm.
gold: De cada 100 mujeres que utilizaron la esponja durante un año, unas 25 quedaron embarazadas.
translated_output: En la prueba del Reino Unido, costó 24,5 libras comprar una esponja y 10,9 libras comprar un diafragma.
old_gold: For each 100 women who used the sponge for a year, about 25 got pregnant.

input: The contraceptive vaginal sponge was developed as an alternative to the contraceptive diaphragm.
output: The contraceptive vaginal sponge is a different kind of birth control that was created to give people another option besides using a contraceptive diaphragm.
gold: La esponja contiene una sustancia química para matar los espermatozoides.
translated_output: La esponja vaginal anticonceptiva es un tipo diferente de control de la natalidad que se creó para brindarles a las personas otra opción además de usar un diafragma anticonceptivo.
